intro: Byrsocarpus puniceus, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant red, pink, or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical characteristics include small, capsule-like fruits that release seeds when mature. Byrsocarpus puniceus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
